author: Admin
title: Cool weather helping heat up business in Martin County - Top World News Today
text: STUART, Fla. — Locals and tourists in downtown Stuart said Friday they have been enjoying the [cooler temperatures](https://www.wptv.com/weather/forecast-12-29-23) as they prepare to ring in the new year. Several local business owners said the drop in temperature is good for their bottom line. “[It is a] perfect night for date night, just cool weather,” Treasure Coast resident Jennifer Berryhill said. “We love it.” “I think it’s a beautiful night, especially to come to Townies Tavern,” Treasure Coast resident Evan Milligan said. “They have the heaters going.” Summer Jackson, an employee at Island Cotton clothing store in Stuart, said this is their peak season, but Friday night has been especially busy. “There’s been a lot of people walking through,” Jackson said. “It’s really nice … because a lot of people come and they browse, and they find something that catches their eye, so the crowd has actually been pretty big.” Treasure Coast locals said they have noticed plenty of people out and about. “I have a lot noticed a lot of people, a little more busy during the holiday season,” Berryhill said. “Just enjoying the night and it’s just great, just cooler weather, just brings out more spunkiness.” At Townies Tavern in Palm City, locals are enjoying the atmosphere that comes with the holiday season. “We’re getting busier, thank God,” Tiffany Ferrugio, an employee at Townies Tavern said. “People love the cold weather. It’s hot down here, so when it gets cold, people just love to be out here in the cold.” Both businesses are anticipating an even busier holiday weekend. “We are really hoping because it’s supposed to be chillier, so I’m really hoping that’ll bring more people outside,” Jackson said. The Highland Griffith Chamber of Commerce will begin 2024 with new leadership and officers on its Board of Directors, according to a release. author: world today news
title: Controversial Claim by Shaman Durek Verrett Sparks Outrage: ‘Suicidal Spirit’ Exorcism Technique Causes Uproar
text:
SHAMAN: Durek Verrett.
Photo: Frode Hansen / VG
Petter Eide in the organization Leve reacts to Durek Verrett’s claim that there is a suicidal spirit that can be exorcised.
Published:
Less than 40 minutes ago
Updated just now
In a new
video on Instagram, Verrett says he will share shamanic knowledge and techniques on how to deal with suicide.
– Yes, we are talking about something heavy here, but it is important for us to be able to protect ourselves. In shamanism, we believe that there is a suicidal spirit, says Verrett, who is engaged to Princess Märtha Louise.
Verrett claims that one can get rid of the “suicidal spirit” themselves. He tells about a technique that will help you get this spirit out of you.
This technique involves, among other things, breathing and saying a few selected words to remove the “suicide spirit”.
– Almost at a loss for words
Petter Eide, chairman of Leve – the National Association for survivors of suicide – believes this is a life-threatening message.
– Here he makes a claim that suicide is caused by a spirit taking up residence in your body and that you should be able to drive it out with the help of your own thinking power. I hardly have words for how upset I get when I hear such nonsense. He plays with people’s lives, says Eide to VG.
Over 600 people take their own lives every year, according to the Norwegian Institute of Public
Health (FHI).
FHI does not have figures on attempts, but Eide believes that perhaps ten times as many attempt it or have suicidal thoughts every year.
LEVE: Petter Eide is chairman of the National Association for Survivors of Suicide.
Photo: Helge Mikalsen / VG
Eide points out that research on suicide shows that you should seek professional help and fellowship, not sit alone with your thoughts.
– Verrett pushes this exclusively back on the individual, without explanation or connection – just that an evil spirit has taken up residence in you that you can drive out yourself. What he says can make it worse.
– It is difficult to imagine him in the royal family with this type of attitude, says Eide, and points out that Durek Verrett is marrying Princess Märtha Louise in Geiranger this summer.
– Shamanism a supplement to the healthcare system
Durek Verrett has been submitted to the criticism, via his spokesperson in Norway, Simon Valvik.
Valvik says Verret’s content is intended for his followers and supporters who are familiar with his methods and practices of shamanism.
The majority of followers are Americans, not Norwegians, according to Valvik.
– In the
USA, there is closer contact between alternative medicine and school medicine. I see shamanism as a useful addition to the healthcare system, as many people in America also do, says Durek Verrett.
Those who do not agree with him do not have to follow him either, says Verrett.
At the same time, he says that he recognizes the importance of the
health system and school medicine.
– I respect what professionals, such as doctors and psychologists do, and I don’t try to tell them how to do their job. It’s about respecting each other and understanding that we all have different ways of helping people, says Verret.
He says that he wants to be able to offer an alternative to those who want it.
The press guard at the Castle tells VG that on a general basis they do not comment on statements from Durek Verrett.
Need someone to talk to?
By for urgent crisis assistance, you must call 113. If you want to get in touch with your local emergency room, call 116 117.
There are several helplines, chat services and support groups where you can share your thoughts and feelings completely anonymously, and get support, advice and guidance.
Here you will find more
 helplines and chat services which can be helpful when you are having a hard time.
For children and young people:
Source: Helsenorge.no
Published:
Published: 29.12.23 at 15:59
Updated: 29.12.23 at 16:36
2023-12-29 14:59:51

author: ansa.it
title: La Colombia preoccupata per il Papa invia suo affetto e prega - America Latina - Ansa.it
text:
Il governo colombiano ha espresso preoccupazione per la salute di Papa Francesco e ha inviato un messaggio di affetto al Pontefice per il suo sostegno incondizionato alla pace locale, pregando per il suo pronto miglioramento, in una lettera firmata dal ministro degli Esteri, Laura Sarabia, e indirizzata al cardinale Pietro Parolin.
 "Eminenza Reverendissima, con il più grande e sincero apprezzamento, vorremmo ringraziare per le preghiere del Santo Padre per il nostro Paese e l'umanità, e porgerle i migliori auguri per la sua guarigione, affinché, Sua Santità, possa continuare il suo ministero a favore delle persone in tutto il mondo con la sua voce come faro di speranza", si legge in un passaggio della lettera, diffusa da Sarabia.
 La ministra degli esteri ha ricordato che Francesco ha contribuito con i suoi messaggi e le sue preghiere agli "sforzi di costruzione della pace in Colombia" ed è stato, tra l'altro, un "incentivo" affinché il Paese continui nella ricerca della pace sociale.

author: @kjzzphoenix
title: SMoCA pays homage to the vivid color fields of Arizona artist Dorothy Fratt | KJZZ's The Show
text: SMoCA pays homage to the vivid color fields of Arizona artist Dorothy Fratt An exhibit at the Scottsdale Museum of Contemporary Art pays tribute to a Phoenix artist you may not have heard of before. “Dorothy Fratt: Color Mirage” is the first large-scale solo exhibition of Fratt’s work in a U.S. museum. Dorothy Fratt lived in the Phoenix area for more than 70 years. To get here, she drove cross-country with four kids in 1958; she died in 2017. The Show recently visited SMoCA to talk to Jennifer McCabe about Dorothy Fratt and her work. McCabe is the museum’s director and chief curator. How would she describe Fratt’s painting style? “It did evolve over time,” McCabe said, “but her works that she is most known for are large-scale color field, what we would call color field. And so that just means they’re big patches of usually bright colors, often with shapes. She had a lot of different philosophies about painting, and so she explored those through her paintings.” What were some of those philosophies? “One was dialogue. So different colors and shapes in conversation within the paintings. Another was about the periphery, so she explored formes around the outsides of the painting. She painted a lot of landscapes, so ... knowing the titles of her works is really helpful because it will give you a clue as to what you might be looking at,” McCabe said. “And what's so interesting about (Fratt) is that when she was painting this color field or abstract style, people really wanted to see cowboys, horses, sunsets,” she added. “They wanted that Western feel. And she did it, but in her own unique way. So that's what makes her work really special to me.” We turn a corner and see more bright, vibrant colors — but instead of on canvas, these are prints. “Yes, she did a lot of prints,” McCabe explained. “She worked with another local artist, John Armstrong, who is a master printmaker. And he told me this wonderful story about printing with Dorothy, and they ran out of an orange color in the middle of the run. And she said, ‘No worries. I’ll be right back.’ And she left the room, came back with an exact match. She had left and mixed the same orange color. So she had a visual memory of color that really stood out to this master printmaker.” The exhibit is arranged chronologically, which allows visitors to follow along as Fratt’s style evolved over time. The Show asked McCabe what stands out to her about Fratt’s later work, relative to what we saw from earlier in her career. “As we move into the ’80s and ’90s, the scale of the paintings increases. So they’re a much larger scale. Really vibrant colors, as we were talking about — so we’ve got some royal blues and bright reds. Additionally, she really explores the edges of the paintings with her forms but also, in one particular painting, her signature. She signs the painting on all four edges so that you can rotate it when you display it,” McCabe said. “Dorothy Fratt: Color Mirage” will be on display at SMoCA through July 21.

author: Carmen Mörwald
title: „Tomorrowland"-Inferno: Festival-Bühne in Flammen - Veranstalter reagiert
text:
„Tomorrowland“-Inferno: Festival-Bühne in Flammen – Veranstalter reagiert
Ein Feuer zerstörte die Hauptbühne des „Tomorrowland“-Festivals. Die Ursache des Brandes ist noch unklar – ebenso, ob das Festival nun stattfinden kann.
Update vom 17. Juli, 6.40 Uhr: Bereits im Vorfeld des vergangenen „Tomorrowland“-Festivals hatte das Team betont, dass das Design der ikonischen Hauptbühne vollständig in Eigenregie entstanden sei – von den ersten Ideen bis hin zur finalen Umsetzung. Über zwei Jahre hinweg habe das hauseigene Kreativteam mit viel Hingabe an der spektakulären Kulisse gearbeitet. „Jahrelange Liebe und Leidenschaft sind in den Aufbau dieser Bühne geflossen. Die Teams sind am Boden zerstört“, sagte Festivalsprecherin Debby Wilmsen am Mittwochabend (16. Juli) auf einer Pressekonferenz.
Brand zerstört Hauptbühne von „Tomorrowland“-Festival: DJs zeigen sich bestürzt
„Ich habe das gerade überall in den News gesehen. Es bricht mir das Herz“, so Charlotte de Witte, die am Samstag beim „Tomorrowland“ spielen sollte, bei Instagram. Auch die DJs Armin van Buuren und Boris Brejcha zeigten sich betroffen, während Afrojack vor allem erleichtert ist, dass es keine Verletzten gab. Das Duo Blasterjaxx lobte die Crew für ihren Einsatz: „Respekt an die Crew, dass sie es dennoch stattfinden lassen wollen.“ Anouk Matton, die auf der Hauptbühne auftreten sollte, sagte noch vor ihrem Set im Ushuaïa auf Ibiza: „Ich bin völlig geschockt … Ich hoffe sehr, dass das Festival trotzdem stattfinden kann.“
Selbst das konkurrierende Festival „Parookaville“ meldete sich zu Wort und kommentierte unter einem Beitrag von „Tomorrowland“: „Wir schicken all unsere Liebe.“
Update vom 16, Juli, 22.37 Uhr: Auch eine Sprecherin der Feuerwehr bestätigte, dass es bislang keine Verletzten durch den Brand auf dem Gelände des „Tomorrowland“-Festivals gebe. Rettungsdienste sind vor Ort, so die belgische Nachrichtenagentur Belga. Der Fokus liege aktuell auf der Sicherheit der anwesenden Mitarbeiter.
Trotz des Brandes und der zerstörten Hauptbühne soll das Festival stattfinden. Das berichtet die Deutsche Presse-Agentur (dpa) unter Berufung auf eine Festival-Sprecherin.
Nach Brand auf dem „Tomorrowland“-Gelände: Festival-Veranstalter äußert sich
Update vom 16. Juli, 20.58 Uhr: Jetzt hat sich auch der Veranstalter des „Tomorrowland“ zu Wort gemeldet. Auf der Homepage spricht man von einem „schweren Zwischenfall und Brand“ auf der Hauptbühne. Diese sei „schwer beschädigt“ worden. Immerhin könne man bestätigen, dass niemand verletzt sei.
Dennoch werde der Campingplatz „Dreamville“ am Donnerstag, 17. Juli, wie geplant für Besucher öffnen. Zudem würden alle sogenannten Global Journey-Aktivitäten rund um das Festival in Brüssel und Antwerpen „wie geplant“ stattfinden.
Doch was heißt das für das Festival an sich? „Wir arbeiten mit Hochdruck an der Lösung des Festivalwochenendes (Freitag – Samstag – Sonntag)“, heißt es vom Veranstalter. Neue Informationen will man „so bald wie möglich bekannt geben.“
Erstmeldung vom 17. Juli: Es sollte das Musik-Highlight des Sommers werden, doch jetzt steht alles in Flammen! Die gigantische Hauptbühne des weltberühmten Tomorrowland-Festivals in Belgien ist am Mittwochabend komplett abgebrannt. Nur zwei Tage vor dem offiziellen Start des Mega-Events verwandelte sich die spektakuläre Bühne in ein Flammenmeer.
Kurz vor Festival-Beginn: „Tomorrowland“-Bühne plötzlich in Flammen
Schockierende Bilder zeigen eine gewaltige schwarze Rauchwolke, die über dem Festivalgelände im belgischen Boom bei Antwerpen aufsteigt. Laut dem belgischem Rundfunk BRF waren während des Brandes auch Geräusche von Feuerwerkskörpern zu hören. Die Hauptbühne ist nahezu vollständig zerstört.
„Die Rettungskräfte sind vor Ort; unsere oberste Priorität ist jetzt die Sicherheit“, erklärte Festivalsprecherin Debby Wilmsen der niederländischen Tageszeitung De Telegraaf. Menschen in der Umgebung wird geraten, Fenster und Türen geschlossen zu halten.
„Tomorrowland“-Gelände wegen Brand evakuiert – Unklar, ob Festival stattfinden kann
Zum Zeitpunkt des Unglücks befanden sich keine Festivalbesucher auf dem Gelände, aber rund 1.000 Mitarbeiter, die mit den Vorbereitungen beschäftigt waren. Wie der flämische Sender VRT berichtet, wurde das gesamte Gelände evakuiert. Ob es Verletzte gibt, ist derzeit noch unklar.
Das Tomorrowland-Festival sollte am Freitag beginnen und bis Sonntag dauern. Jährlich strömen rund 400.000 Techno- und Elektro-Fans aus aller Welt zu dem Event. Für dieses Jahr waren Star-DJs wie ArminVan Buuren, Charlotte De Witte und Swedish House Mafia, David Guetta und Robin Schulz angekündigt. Ob das Festival wie geplant stattfinden kann, ist nach dem verheerenden Brand völlig unklar. (sp/cln)

author: The U.S. Sun
title: How Putin’s ‘Oreshnik’ hypersonic missile dodged Ukraine’s defences with cluster-bomb warheads – and could go NUCLEAR
text:
News PressBee .. The U.S. Sun Watch the post from How Putin’s ‘Oreshnik’ hypersonic missile dodged Ukraine’s defences with cluster-bomb warheads – and could go NUCLEAR, Now to the details
RUSSIAN tyrant Vladimir Putin struck Ukraine with a hypersonic ballistic missile yesterday – a weapon that the US has warned could be made nuclear. The medium-range “Oreshnik” rocket pierced through Ukrainian defences dropping a cluster-bomb of warheads on the city of Dnipro in an early morning blitz on Thursday. Video shows how a family of Russian missiles – including the RS-24, RS-26 and Oreshnik – might operate It gives a simulation of the RS-24 – with a slew of warheads exploding from the missile The warheads – conventional or nuclear – rai
how putin rsquo s lsquo oreshnik rsquo hypersonic missile dodged

title: 北京今天迎降雨，阵风五六级，最高气温25℃ 伴有雷电请注意安全_新闻频道_中华网
text:
用微信扫描二维码分享至好友和朋友圈
北京市气象台5月8日6时发布天气预报，今天早晨有轻雾，白天多云转阴并伴有雷阵雨，南风三级左右，阵风可达五六级，最高气温预计为25℃。夜间仍将是阴天且有雷阵雨，风向将从南转北，风力减弱至二级左右，最低气温降至13℃。今明两天将出现明显降水过程，并伴有雷电，请注意防雨防雷电，确保出行安全。
